p: Cyclosporine A is a lipophilic cyclic polypeptide used as an immunosuppressant drug for immunomodulation in transplant recipients. Oral dosing has limited effectiveness, because of its limited aqueous solubility, low intestinal permeation, and P-g efflux [ 107]. Thus, researchers incorporated TPGS1000 in SEDDSs as an efflux inhibitor to increase the intestinal absorption of oral cyclosporine A [ 108]. The optimized nanocarriers had good stability in simulated GI fluids. These SEDDSs had faster drug release and 4.5-fold greater oral bioavailability than the commercial product (Bioral Â®). The nephrotoxicity of these SEDDSs was negligible, based on measurements of blood urea nitrogen and plasma creatinine.
